description.narrative: Institutions at a national ie MaMwe and ANACM and community ie UCEA and UCEM level strengthened to integrate climate change information into water resource management

1 Number of policy documents at the Union decisional level the island decisional level and the communitylocal level revised or elaborated to include regulations and provisions that promote gender equitable adaptation in the water sector

comment.narrative: 1 Water Act for the Union of Comoros does not have any regulations for application There is one environmental law and environment strategy but lack of regulation for adaptation The Comoros agricultural strategy dates back from 1994 and has not been implemented Water management is only considered from the point of view of intensification not rainfall scarcity or intensification of rainfall
The Water Act is revised and includes regulations and provisions that promote genderequitable adaptation

Whereas the revisions of the water act were removed from this project as they were undertaken by another project the project has provided technical support to the development of rules of procedures for water user groups Once the revised water code has been approved by the government the project will support training of local authorities in its applications The project also delivered training for all water stakeholders and further training on the maintenance of rehabilitated infrastructure is foreseen in september 2015 for the 3 managment accords concerning the 9 communities from the 9 villages concerned by the setting of the new water infrastructures Further policy development work was put on hold while infrastructure works were completed and should be completed in the latter half of 2015
In total about 21 planners have been trained and sensitized by the project to use in the future adjusted methods for the integration of climate change in addition to all the participants in the elaboration of the new development strategy of the country namely the Strategy for Accelerated Growth and Sustainable Development SCA2D All these can be considered as incentives conditions put in place to allow these planners to use the adjusted methods

description.narrative: 2 The number of policymakers and planners at the Union and island levels using adjusted processes and methods eg collecting water data and climate data modelling climate trends and monitoring water quality and supply to develop genderequitable water management policies that integrate climate change projections

comment.narrative: Policy makers and planners at the Union and Island levels do not currently integrate knowledge of climate change into policies related to water and agriculture and they lack capacities to collect water data to model climate change and to monitor water quality and supply At the Union level there are a total of 20 policy makers and planners
By the end of the project at least 10 planners use methods ajusted to take CC into consideration in order to develop water management policies that take the climate projections into consideration

The project has worked on recommandations to be used for the implementation of the new Water Act so that decisions may be taken in consideration of CC impacts and previsions Tranings on the climate modeling for water resources management were done on behalf of planers water resources users both at institutional and private sector level In addition the project is working on tools and methods for sharing climate data among islands based on the creation of a database of climate data and on the installation of monitoring equipment

description.narrative: 1 Overall perception of the population per pilot site on i the daily quantity of water accessible for domestic uses iithe facility of access to this water and iiithe quality of the waer used as per WHO standards on a rating of 14 1 very satisfied 2 satisfied 3 unsatisfied 4 very unsatisfied

comment.narrative: Moroni Quantity 3 Access 3 Quality 3 Djandro Quantity 4 access 4 Quality 4 High Nioumakele in Anjouan Quantity 3 Accesss 2 Quality 3 LingoniPomoni in Anjouan Quantity 2 Access 4 Quality 3
Raise the rating to 2 for all three criteria across all project sites

Total installed network is as follows LingoniPomoni 2 villages water networks 1300 linear meters of main pipe and 10230 linear meters of distribution network HoaniMbatsé 2 villages water network 1100 linear meters of main pipe and 9110 linear meters and main distribution network including the installation of a green ecological filter on each network in Anjouan and Moheli Concerning the agglomeration of Moroni which composed of town and 13 surrounding villages project intervention has consisted in the installation of around 14000 linear meters of pipes to totally renew main pipe of the network plus the installation of an automatic water treatment unit at the TP5 borehole to assure safe water to the population
The lifetime achievement in Moroni network level leads to the following situation
Pass the loss of over 60 at present to less than 5 at the main
Be able to quantify the volumes produced at the TP5 and ONU4 pumping stations including through the establishment of totalizers counters
Improve water quality through the establishment of a modern and adapted water treatment unit but also by the establishment of a healthier water main
Pass the maximum water availability level of RB2000 main tank from 3800m3 to 9200m3 currently after the commissioning of the new two pipes installed
Increase water per capita allocation of 46 literscapitaday currently to 70 literscapitaday in 2033 even with a connection rate of 100
Reduce the pumping time from 24 hours to 16 hours reflecting a decrease in the high risk of salinization of the aquifer and reinforce the sustainability of the resource
The project has undertaken some water quality analysis at the beginning of its activities and will do the same after the commissioning of all networks to confirm the improvement of water quality at all project sites which will certainly result in the improvement of communities health also
